intro: Ionidium aurantiacum, commonly known as the red-flowered ironweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, orange-red composite flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade in moist, well-drained soils. Ionidium aurantiacum is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
